page.title: 10STRETTINGTON & WESTERTON
page.content: {1895/1908.}(by Debbie Collins) {STRETTINGTON.}is a very small village with no shops or Public Houses. Most of the houses are finely built and have very large gardens. One house has its own stables. Near the crossroads on the Lavant Straight at the northern end of the village there are several cottages built with flint walls and tiled roofs. The houses are well spread out so that strettington is a long straggly village situated on a country lane. At the southern end is Temple Bar Farm and Strettington Farm. Both are arable farms. {WESTERTON}is a single street in a horse shoe shape joined to a main road with a row of Goodwood Estate Houses. There are also several large private houses. At the end of the village is a Civil Defence Depot from the 2nd World War that is now disused.
